title: You can spend the night at a Kentucky distillery for the price of one bottle of bourbon
text:
CLOSE Single barrel bourbon selections at Jim Beam/Knob Creek and Four Roses

Good news, bourbon fans. You'll soon be able to book an Airbnb getaway on Jim Beam's distillery grounds in Clermont, Kentucky.

The company announced Tuesday it's opening its 1919 rustic three-bedroom, two-and-a-half bath home to Airbnb booking on Oct. 21 through the end of the year, reports the Louisville Courier Journal, which is part of the USA TODAY Network.

The home overlooks Everbach Lake on the distillery's grounds and comes with a full bar stocked with Jim Beam bourbons, a fireplace, a backyard and fishing docks.

Bourbon fans who are 21 or older will be able to book a one-night stay in the home through Airbnb "where they will live, eat and even sleep like the seven generations of Master Distillers."

Jim Beam is renting its home on Airbnb (Photo: Jim Beam)

“There’s no better time to experience bourbon country than during the cool, crisp months of fall, so we’re welcoming bourbon fans to join the Beam family during an overnight stay at our home in the rolling hills of Kentucky,” Fred Noe, Jim Beam’s 7th Generation Master Distiller and Airbnb property host, said in a statement.

“We like to say that anyone who visits us comes as friends and leaves as family, so we’re thrilled to welcome our extended family for some bourbon and Kentucky hospitality.”

Jim Beam is renting its home on Airbnb (Photo: Jim Beam)

"Once guests have learned how the world’s #1 bourbon is crafted," the company said in a statement, "they can enjoy the other elements of the Stillhouse, including an original staircase from the Jim Beam distillery circa Prohibition, a bourbon bar with seasonal cocktails and dinner at Fred’s Smokehouse, which serves bourbon BBQ selections that are inspired by Beam family recipes."

Jim Beam is renting its home on Airbnb (Photo: Jim Beam)

To book, go to Fred Noe's Airbnb profile at airbnb.com/rooms and select your date. Reservations are first-come, first-serve.

Part of the one-night stay includes a distillery tour and bourbon tasting, Kentucky barbecue meals and behind-the-scenes looks into bourbon making.

Each stay costs $23, the company said. It's the equivalent of a premium bottle of extra-aged Jim Beam Black.
